intro: Scyphularia simplicifolia, commonly known as the simpleleaf scyphularia, is a flowering plant native to North America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in moist, open habitats such as meadows and wetlands. It features narrow, lance-shaped leaves and produces yellow flowers that bloom in the summer. Scyphularia simplicifolia is often used in ecological restoration projects due to its ability to stabilize soil and support pollinator populations.
